ECRootView 
  public ECRootView()

setBounds 
  public void setBounds(int x,
                        int y,
                        int width,
                        int height)
Pins width and height to those of minSize(), unless minSize is null. This allows a workaround for subview resizing bugs that occur after subviews have been sized to negative widths or heights. This would not be necessary if ExternalWindow respected its own minSize, but a comment in the IFC documentation claims that this is a bug in AWT.
Overrides:
setBounds in class View

removeAllTips 
  public void removeAllTips()
removeTipForView 
  public void removeTipForView(View view)
getCancelButton 
  public Button getCancelButton()
Returns the cancel button. The cancel button is activated by the Escape key unless the focused view uses it.
getDefaultButton 
  public Button getDefaultButton()
Returns the default button. The default button that is activated by the Return or Enter key unless the focused view uses it.
handleEscapeKey 
  public void handleEscapeKey()
Activates the cancel button if appropriate. Other classes can call this explicitly to activate the cancel button (if any), but it's usually easier to implement ECKeyFilter and return false for wantsEscapeKey.
See Also:
processEvent, ECKeyFilter
handleReturnKey 
  public void handleReturnKey()
Activates the default button if appropriate. Other classes can call this explicitly to activate the default button (if any), but it's usually easier to implement ECKeyFilter and return false for wantsReturnKey.
See Also:
processEvent, ECKeyFilter
setCancelButton 
  public void setCancelButton(Button newCancelButton)
Sets the cancel button.
See Also:
getCancelButton
setDefaultButton 
  public void setDefaultButton(Button newDefaultButton)
Sets the default button.
See Also:
getDefaultButton
